articles.author: Amy Thomson
articles.title: How Trial by Skype Became the Norm in Immigration Court
articles.description: Tess Feldman stood in an empty San Francisco courtroom, facing a three-foot-wide television screen. “Good morning!” she shouted toward a camera connected to the TV. “Can you hear me?” A stunned-looking man in an orange prison jumpsuit appeared on screen. An i…

articles.author: Robin Urevich, Capital & Main
articles.title: What Happened at an Immigrant Detention Center While ICE Officials Looked the Other Way?
articles.description: Needing detention space, ICE has used noncompetitive contracts called Intergovernmental Service Agreements to quickly bring beds online. But is the government failing to impose accountability standards on its sprawling immigrant-prison system?

articles.author: By Aura Bogado / Reveal News
articles.title: Here’s How ICE Sent Children Seeking Asylum to Adult Detention Centers
articles.description: Two teens fleeing violence in war-torn countries sought asylum in the U.S. A Texas dentist’s report helped ICE send them to adult detention centers.

articles.author: Aura Bogado
articles.title: Here’s how ICE sent children seeking asylum to adult detention centers
articles.description: ICE continues to disobey Congressional orders to stop dental and bone scans on minors seeking asylum in the U.S.
